trans-unit.source: Call a custom API from an HTML client - Mobile Services
trans-unit.target: Call a custom API from an HTML client - Mobile Services

trans-unit.source: Learn how to define a custom API and then call it from an HTML app that uses Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to define a custom API and then call it from an HTML app that uses Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to call a custom API from an HTML application.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to call a custom API from an HTML application.

trans-unit.source: A custom API enables you to define custom endpoints that expose server functionality that does not map to an insert, update, delete, or read operation.
trans-unit.target: A custom API enables you to define custom endpoints that expose server functionality that does not map to an insert, update, delete, or read operation.

trans-unit.source: By using a custom API, you can have more control over messaging, including reading and setting HTTP message headers and defining a message body format other than JSON.
trans-unit.target: By using a custom API, you can have more control over messaging, including reading and setting HTTP message headers and defining a message body format other than JSON.

trans-unit.source: The custom API created in this topic gives you the ability to send a single POST request that sets the completed flag to true for all the todo items in the table.
trans-unit.target: The custom API created in this topic gives you the ability to send a single POST request that sets the completed flag to true for all the todo items in the table.

trans-unit.source: Without this custom API, the client would have to send individual requests to update the flag for each todo item in the table.
trans-unit.target: Without this custom API, the client would have to send individual requests to update the flag for each todo item in the table.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile Services quickstart.

trans-unit.source: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Add Mobile Services to an existing app].
trans-unit.target: Before you start this tutorial, you must first complete [Get started with Mobile Services] or [Add Mobile Services to an existing app].

trans-unit.source: Using your text editor, open the index.html file, locate the button element named buttonRefresh, and add the following new element right after it:
trans-unit.target: Using your text editor, open the index.html file, locate the button element named buttonRefresh, and add the following new element right after it:

trans-unit.source: This adds a new button to the page.
trans-unit.target: This adds a new button to the page.

trans-unit.source: In page.js, and after the refreshTodoItems function, add the following code:
trans-unit.target: In page.js, and after the refreshTodoItems function, add the following code:

trans-unit.source: This method handles the Click event for the new button.
trans-unit.target: This method handles the Click event for the new button.

trans-unit.source: The invokeApi method is called on the client, which sends a POST request to the new custom API.
trans-unit.target: The invokeApi method is called on the client, which sends a POST request to the new custom API.

trans-unit.source: The result returned by the custom API is displayed in a message dialog, as are any errors.
trans-unit.target: The result returned by the custom API is displayed in a message dialog, as are any errors.

trans-unit.source: Refresh your browser.
trans-unit.target: Refresh your browser.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type some text in Insert a TodoItem, then click Save.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type some text in Insert a TodoItem, then click Save.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the previous step until you have added several todo items to the list.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the previous step until you have added several todo items to the list.

trans-unit.source: Click the Complete All button.
trans-unit.target: Click the Complete All button.

trans-unit.source: A message dialog is displayed that indicates the number of items marked complete and the filtered query is executed again, which clears all items from the list.
trans-unit.target: A message dialog is displayed that indicates the number of items marked complete and the filtered query is executed again, which clears all items from the list.

trans-unit.source: This topic showed how to use the invokeApi function to call a fairly simple custom API from your HTML/JavaScript app.
trans-unit.target: This topic showed how to use the invokeApi function to call a fairly simple custom API from your HTML/JavaScript app.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about using the invokeApi function, see the post Custom API in Azure Mobile Services.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about using the invokeApi function, see the post Custom API in Azure Mobile Services.

trans-unit.source: Also, consider finding out more about the following Mobile Services topics:
trans-unit.target: Also, consider finding out more about the following Mobile Services topics:

trans-unit.source:
[Mobile Services server script reference]
Learn more about creating custom APIs.
trans-unit.target:
[Mobile Services server script reference]
Learn more about creating custom APIs.

trans-unit.source:
[Store server scripts in source control]
Learn how to use the source control feature to more easily and securely develop and publish custom API script code.
trans-unit.target:
[Store server scripts in source control]
Learn how to use the source control feature to more easily and securely develop and publish custom API script code.
